description: a(n) is the smallest k such that phi(k)=n, where phi is Euler's totient function.
links: T. D. Noe, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..10000
example: The smallest k such that phi(k)=2 is k=3, so a(2)=3.
prog: (PARI) a(n)=if(n>2,for(k=n+1,solve(x=n,2*n^2,x/(exp(Euler)*log(log(x))+3/log(log(x)))-n),if(eulerphi(k)==n,return(k)));0,2*n-1) \\ _Charles R Greathouse IV_, Nov 28 2012(PARI) x=1000;v=vector(x\(exp(Euler)*log(log(x))+3/log(log(x)))); for(n=1,x,t=eulerphi(n); if(t<=#v && !v[t], v[t]=n)); v \\ _Charles R Greathouse IV_, Nov 28 2012
author: _Jud McCranie_, Oct 10 2000
